Short Description: AUTO - Stand Alone Trade-in Issue
Description: Having issue with IMEI 657863487658765. Customer is selling the phone to us through stand-alone trade-in but is receiving a notification of "Lost or Stolen". The device does not appear as lost or stolen in ACSS and MTAS Tool.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-01-17T14:32:00Z</timestamp>
  <service>B360</service>
  <error>Validation Failed: Device incorrectly marked as lost/stolen</error>
  <imei>657863487658765</imei>
</log>
Root Cause: Incorrect flagging inapplication due to stale database sync issue.
Resolution: Database synchronization logic was updated to ensure real-time validation.

Short Description: Trade-In: Validation Failed: Device ID DP Loan status not eligible for Trade.
Description: (pos_msg) Validation Failed: Device ID DP Loan status not eligible for Trade. Attempted trade-in for business account line 876576565 with an iPhone 14 128GB IMEI 6587576587576. The device is still locked, but no active loan records exist.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2024-11-17T11:21:45Z</timestamp>
  <service>DP Loan Validation</service>
  <error>Device ID flagged as loaned incorrectly</error>
  <imei>6587576587576</imei>
</log>
Root Cause: Incorrect loan status retrieved due to outdated cache in DP Loan validation service.
Resolution: Cache invalidation mechanism updated to fetch the latest loan status.

Short Description: AUTO - Validation Failed: Lost or Stolen
Description: We attempted a stand-alone trade-in using B360 for IMEI 654376576546547 but received the error: "Validation Failed: Lost or Stolen." Confirmed through MTAS and Fraud services that the device is not on any lost/stolen/non-payment/fraud list. Device ID history confirms activation on MTN 6576576578.
Root Cause: Legacy data ingestion issue caused invalid flagging in application.
Resolution: Updated ingestion pipeline to exclude outdated loss/stolen status.

Short Description: Standalone Trade-In Error: IMEI Misclassification
Description: Device IMEI 789654123654789 flagged as lost/stolen in B360, despite no such record in ACSS or MTAS. Trade-in request failed.
Root Cause: System error in IMEI validation.
Resolution: Updated validation logic to cross-check multiple sources.

Short Description: Trade-In Blocked Due to Incorrect Fraud Alert
Description: IMEI 567834678234567 rejected in application due to an invalid fraud alert. The device has no fraud history upon manual verification.
Root Cause: Outdated fraud data source.
Resolution: Adjusted fraud data pipeline for real-time updates.

Short Description: IMEI Verification Failure on Trade-In Submission
Description: Device IMEI 567894321678943 was rejected due to an incorrect lost/stolen flag. No fraud or non-payment history found upon investigation.
Root Cause: Synchronization issue between fraud detection service and trade-in system.
Resolution: Implemented real-time synchronization for fraud status validation.

Short Description: Trade-In: Validation Error - Device Flagged as Lost or Stolen
Description: Customer attempted trade-in using  application for IMEI 356789123456789, but received an error: "Validation Failed: Lost or Stolen." The device was checked in ACSS and MTAS, but no lost/stolen flags were found.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log timestamp="2025-01-15T10:45:32Z">
  <error>Validation Failed: Lost or Stolen</error>
  <device_id>356789123456789</device_id>
  <system>B360</system>
  <status>Trade-In Blocked</status>
</log>
Root Cause: Mismatch between app and MTAS device status validation.
Resolution: Adjusted validation logic in app API.

Short Description: Activation failure – ACCOUNT NO LONGER QUALIFIES FOR SERVICE PRODUCT OFFER 1529
Description: Customer order failed due to account qualification error. Error encountered: Application Error: ACCOUNT NO LONGER QUALIFIES FOR THE SERVICE PRODUCT OFFER 1500
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-02-05T14:32:45Z</timestamp>
  <level>ERROR</level>
  <message>Application Error: ACCOUNT NO LONGER QUALIFIES FOR SERVICE PRODUCT OFFER 1500</message>
  <service>ActivationProcessor</service>
  <details>
    <orderID>789123</orderID>
    <location>D43211</location>
    <imei>356478902134567</imei>
  </details>
</log>
Root Cause: An outdated eligibility check in the service activation module rejected valid customer orders.
Resolution: Updated logic in AccountValidationService.java and ActivationProcessor.java on GitHub to allow valid activations.

Short Description: Customer activation repeatedly fails – PRODUCT OFFER ERROR 1768
Description:
A customer at store 5421 reports multiple activation failures for different devices.
Error in system logs: ACCOUNT NO LONGER QUALIFIES FOR SERVICE PRODUCT OFFER 1768
Order Details: Order #125467, Location Code: D56782
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-02-06T10:25:30Z</timestamp>
  <level>ERROR</level>
  <message>Application Error: ACCOUNT NO LONGER QUALIFIES FOR SERVICE PRODUCT OFFER 1768</message>
  <service>ActivationProcessor</service>
  <details>
    <orderID>125467</orderID>
    <location>D56782</location>
    <errorCode>1332</errorCode>
  </details>
</log>
Root Cause: The AccountValidationService.java contained an outdated eligibility condition that incorrectly flagged valid customer accounts as ineligible.
Resolution: The logic in AccountValidationService.java and ActivationProcessor.java was updated to properly validate customer eligibility.

Short Description: AUTO - Cannot proceed with activation
Description:
A customer trying to add a line is encountering an error.
Error: MultiLineMixedOrder – Account restrictions prevent activation

Short Description: Activation blocked – ACCOUNT NO LONGER QUALIFIES
Description:
Customer's port-in request for a new line activation failed due to eligibility constraints.
Error displayed: MultiLineMixedOrder – ACCOUNT DOES NOT MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-02-11T15:10:22Z</timestamp>
  <level>ERROR</level>
  <message>MultiLineMixedOrder – ACCOUNT DOES NOT MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS</message>
  <service>ActivationProcessor</service>
  <details>
    <orderID>657321</orderID>
    <location>D54321</location>
    <errorCode>MultiLineMixedOrder</errorCode>
  </details>
</log
Root Cause:
The ActivationProcessor.java module incorrectly categorized certain multi-line activation requests as invalid due to a misconfigured rule in the service eligibility logic.
The system was rejecting valid add-a-line requests under a MultiLineMixedOrder error condition.
Resolution:
Updated ActivationProcessor.java to correctly handle multi-line activations without applying outdated restrictions.
Deployed the fix to production and monitored for successful activations.

Short Description: System error prevents order activation
Description: A customer attempted to activate a new line, but the system failed with an unexpected error. The error logs indicate an issue in the eligibility validation service.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-02-15T09:45:10Z</timestamp>
  <level>ERROR</level>
  <message>Eligibility validation failed: Null response from eligibility service</message>
  <service>ActivationProcessor</service>
  <details>
    <orderID>562789</orderID>
    <location>D78452</location>
    <errorCode>NULL_ELIGIBILITY_RESPONSE</errorCode>
  </details>
</log>
Root Cause: A validation rule in ActivationProcessor.java incorrectly flagged certain customer accounts as ineligible due to a missing API response from the eligibility service.
Resolution:
Fixed ActivationProcessor.java to handle missing API responses gracefully.
Deployed the update and confirmed successful activations post-fix.

Short Description: Customer is not able to activate new line of service due to pending order for IMEI and ICCID
Description: Customer device has been deactivated since June but still showing in ThingSpace as pending. Cannot create new lines due to pending deactivation.
Root Cause: Pending deactivation order blocking new activations.
Resolution: Cleared stale pending deactivation records.

Short Description: AUTO - Order was supposed to be cancelled
Description: Indirect Sales needs assistance with upgrading a phone but a pending order is preventing it.
Root Cause: System did not correctly process order cancellations.
Resolution: Updated order cancellation logic to remove stale pending orders.

Short Description: Unable to complete activation as pending order exists in ACCC and B333
Description: Activation blocked due to a pending switch order.
Root Cause: Old pending switch orders not clearing properly.
Resolution: Implemented cleanup script for stale switch orders.

Short Description: Failed activation due to unresolved pending port order
Description: Customer cannot activate number due to previous port request stuck in pending.
Kibana XML Logs: <log><timestamp>2025-02-15T12:10:30Z</timestamp><level>ERROR</level><message>Port activation failed: Previous port request still pending</message></log>
Root Cause: Port request handler failed to clear old requests.
Resolution: Added automated cleanup for stale port requests.

Short Description: Device swap blocked due to prior transaction errors
Description: Device swap cannot proceed due to an incomplete previous transaction.
Kibana XML Logs: <log><timestamp>2025-02-16T09:35:20Z</timestamp><level>ERROR</level><message>Device swap rejected: Previous swap transaction incomplete</message></log>
Root Cause: Incomplete transaction history preventing new swaps.
Resolution: Updated validation checks to allow valid swaps.

Short Description: Order verification failure in automated system
Description: Order validation error preventing processing for certain IMEIs.
Root Cause: Bug in order verification logic.
Resolution: Fixed IMEI validation rules.

Short Description: Auto-refund process not completing for canceled orders
Description: Refunds not processing automatically due to timeout issues.
Root Cause: Timeouts in refund processing service.
Resolution: Optimized database queries and increased timeout limits.

Short Description: Account suspension preventing new activations
Description: Account flagged as suspended incorrectly, blocking activation.
Root Cause: Incorrect logic in account suspension check.
Resolution: Fixed logic to apply valid suspensions only.

Description: (pos_msg) undefined. Eligibility tile not loading on screen.; ASSISTEDMTN: 7878767850; CURRENT TAB: Account; wSAP:null

Description: (pos_msg) undefined. Eligibility tile not showing on main overview page. ; ASSISTEDMTN: 20268768765; CURRENT TAB: Account; wSAP:null

Short Description: Business Internet Eligibility tile on the landing page is only populating the customer to be eligible for FIOS.
Description: (pos_msg) undefined. The Business Internet Eligibility tile on the landing page is only populating the customer to be eligible for FIOS. It is not pulling LTE or 5G at all. I have also tried using the customers address and manually searching their coverage this route is also only pulling eligibility for FIOS. This is happening on another account also.

Short Description: BCCC Account Inquiry: BI eligibility tile is not showing on Overview page
Description: (pos_msg) undefined. Eligibility square not showing on Overview page. ;

Short Description: BCCC Account Inquiry: Business internet eligibility tile on home screen is not generating the chart
Description: (pos_msg) undefined. Business internet eligibility tile on home screen is not generating the chart. ;

Short Description: BCCC Account Inquiry: Business Internet eligibility does not populate on account main page, on the Business Internet Eligibility tile
Description:
(pos_msg) undefined. Business Internet eligibility does not populate on account main page, on the Business Internet Eligibility tile;
On home page, unable to search eligibility by address via the Business Internet tab.; CURRENT TAB: home;

Short Description: Account type SG : have had 2 failed orders for IBM MaaS 360 order. Was advised by AD in Ops to pen AYS ticket for this.
Description: Unable to order MaaS 260 for the customer, opened 2 get support requests. Can not confirm most recent order had the same issue as the last one because the email address was changed. The first order was done JAN 21 2153601/787657 (order/LOC) , the second was done JAN 28

Short Description: When submitting a Quick tickets, it is not capturing any information to the ticket
Description: when using quick tickets it is not allowing for the qt to get submitted. if the agent clicks submit quick ticket it does not capture any infor and then when we go back to check for an update there is none recorded.

Short Description: Quotes created within 30 days are missing from application Quote Dashboard
Description: Quotes created within 30 days are missing from Quote Dashboard. Sign into  application> Quick Launch >Dashboard > Quotes

Short Description: When submitting a Quick tickets, it is not capturing any information to the ticket
Description: when using quick tickets it is not allowing for the qt to get submitted. if the agent clicks submit quick ticket it does not capture any infor and then when we go back to check for an update there is none recorded.

Short Description: Customer Type: BE Milestones are not applicable for this Order.
Description: Cannot view status tracker milestone or order details for orders above 6months. The Status tracker gives error " Milestones are not applicable for this Order" and view order gives an empty cart

Short Description: OCC Adjustment research
Description:
CB:467546546
B360- OCC Adjustment research
User receivedn an email to open an incident ticket
Order #565765

Short Description: Unable to add wireless handset to Dynamic Bundle Orders
Description: When placing an Dynamic Bundle order and adding a W78, it does not allow us to add a wireless handset (accessory) to the order. The wireless handset is sold separately from the base station and is needed to operate the W78

Short Description: AUTO - Failed activation
Description: FAILED Application Error: 4G/5G DEVICE (IMEI) NOT FOUND IN DMD FOR MTN:546543543 WITH DEVICE ID:765764654543653453 WITH IMEI:56465465358

Short Description: Print pick list shows an error: System Error.Please try again later.
Description: (pos_msg) undefined. Device has been moved to OUTBOUND TRANSFER however we can not access the shipping label as we do not see it in our outbound transfers

Short Description: Transfer your service drop down option unavailable, the account transfer option in the service tab only allows for subaccount transfers within the same account
Description: Create quick ticket :: TYS option is not available in the drop down menu or in the Service tab when selecting lines., The partner does not have the option for Transfer Your Service (TYS) in the drop down and the account transfer option in the service button. The service button only allows for subaccount transfers within the same account. Please review why they no longer have the option to TYS.
Root Cause: Permissions update removed TYS access.
Resolution: Re-enabled access by updating permissions.

Short Description: Transfer your service drop down option unavailable, the account transfer option in the service tab only allows for subaccount transfers within the same account
Description: Create quick ticket :: transfer your service drop down option unavailable and the account transfer option in the service tab only allows for subaccount transfers within the same account
Root Cause: Feature access mistakenly disabled.
Resolution: Restored feature in settings.

Short Description: C2B TYS (TYS-345634) is receiving an error while running credit which states 'POS Exception: no device or SIM specified'
Description: Attempting to transfer line from consumer account to business account, get an error during the run credit screen that says 'POS Exception: no device or SIM specified', active device shows an iPhone 13 pro on the personal account and within the transfer request, tried to clear cache and cookies with the same result
Root Cause: System update broke credit verification.
Resolution: Fixed credit check API logic.

Short Description: TYS option unavailable for business accounts
Description: A corporate partner is attempting to initiate a TYS request but does not see the option in their dashboard. It appears the role-based access control settings have removed this option.
Root Cause: Permissions update removed TYS access.
Resolution: Updated business account role permissions.

Short Description: POS system rejecting transfer due to missing device ID
Description: A customer at a retail store is attempting to transfer service from their existing provider but is encountering an error during the activation process that states 'POS Exception: no device or SIM specified'.
Root Cause: Missing device association in POS system.
Resolution: Implemented fallback device lookup.

Short Description: Transfer request failed at verification
Description: Customer encountered an error at final verification step when attempting to transfer a number. Error message states: 'Transfer request cannot be completed. Please contact support.'
Root Cause: Stricter authentication policy blocked valid transfers.
Resolution: Adjusted authentication rules.

Short Description: Partner unable to initiate service transfer
Description: A partner reports clicking Transfer Service results in a blank screen with no error message. Issue persists across multiple browsers.
Root Cause: JavaScript rendering issue in UI update.
Resolution: Fixed frontend logic.

Short Description: Transfer request error - duplicate transaction
Description: Customer attempted transfer twice, second attempt blocked with error: 'Duplicate transfer request detected. Please try again later.'
Root Cause: System incorrectly flagged rapid attempts as fraud.
Resolution: Implemented cooldown timer.

Short Description: Unable to proceed with account transfer
Description: Attempted account transfer fails with generic error message. System does not provide specific details, preventing resolution.
Root Cause: Backend validation bug rejecting valid transfers.
Resolution: Fixed input validation logic.

Short Description: Ordering: Approval email not being sent to POC even though Order remarks show it being sent
Description: Create quick ticket :: Order 6456 Loc K876872 approval email not being received by the client. Tried all POCs and both HTML and text format, but the emails are not being delivered. The order remarks show that the email was successfully sent, but after verifying with the customer, no email was received. We need to investigate whether there is an issue with the notification system or if the email service is failing to process the request.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-01-17T10:45:23Z</timestamp>
  <level>ERROR</level>
  <service>EmailDispatcher</service>
  <message>Failed to send approval email for Order ID 6456. SMTP relay rejected the request.</message>
  <error>Authentication token expired</error>
</log>
Root Cause: The email notification service encountered an issue where the SMTP relay was rejecting certain automated approval emails due to a misconfigured authentication token.
Resolution: Updated the email service configuration to ensure authentication tokens are refreshed properly. Also implemented a monitoring mechanism to alert for any email delivery failures in the future.

Short Description: Order confirmation email not received by customer despite system showing it was sent
Description: Customer placed an order for a new device and expected to receive an order confirmation email. However, even though the system logs indicate the email was successfully sent, the customer did not receive it. We tested different email providers and confirmed that some customers are not receiving emails due to SMTP failures. Requesting a review of the email service to identify why certain emails are not going through.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-02-05T14:22:10Z</timestamp>
  <level>WARNING</level>
  <service>EmailDispatcher</service>
  <message>Email for Order ID 10239 was sent but not delivered to recipient@example.com.</message>
  <error>SMTP 550: Message rejected due to missing SPF record</error>
</log>
Root Cause: Email notifications were being flagged as spam by certain email providers due to missing SPF and DKIM authentication records.
Resolution: Added proper SPF and DKIM configurations to the email server, ensuring improved email deliverability. Also implemented logging enhancements to track email rejections at the SMTP level.

Short Description: Business client approval email not received when ordering multiple devices
Description: A business client placed an order for multiple devices and expected to receive an approval email for verification. The system logs indicate that the email was generated and sent successfully, but the client never received it. We tested resending the approval email, but it still does not arrive. The issue seems specific to orders containing multiple devices. Requesting an investigation into potential email processing failures when handling bulk orders.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-02-10T16:37:45Z</timestamp>
  <level>ERROR</level>
  <service>EmailDispatcher</service>
  <message>Approval email for Order ID 90876 was not sent. Bulk processing failure.</message>
  <error>Exceeded recipient limit for SMTP transaction</error>
</log>
Root Cause: A bulk email processing bug caused emails to be dropped when more than five recipients were included in the approval request.
Resolution: Fixed the email processing logic to properly queue and send bulk emails without exceeding SMTP server limits.

Short Description: Partner reseller unable to receive order approval emails for business customers
Description: Reseller partners report that business customer approval emails are not arriving in their inboxes. The system confirms that emails are being dispatched, but customers are not receiving them. After multiple tests, we determined that the issue only affects certain business accounts. Requesting a review of whether domain-specific email filtering or policy-based blocking is preventing email delivery.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
  <timestamp>2025-02-12T09:12:30Z</timestamp>
  <level>WARNING</level>
  <service>EmailDispatcher</service>
  <message>Approval email for Order ID 12056 rejected by recipient@examplebiz.com.</message>
  <error>SMTP 554: Rejected due to domain policy</error>
</log>
Root Cause: Certain business domains had restrictive email filtering rules that rejected automated order approval emails.
Resolution: Modified email headers and sender policies to improve compatibility with corporate email filtering settings. Also provided documentation to partners on how to whitelist system-generated emails.

Short Description: AUTO - PROCESSING CLNR
Description: TRIED TROUBLESHOOTING AND DELFI BUT THE ROUTER TURNS 2 SOLID YELLOW LIGHT
Root Cause: Router firmware issue causing incorrect LED indications.
Resolution: Firmware updated and device reset resolved the issue.

Short Description: CLNR UNABLE TO BE PROCESSED - This device is no longer covered under warranty.
Description: CX REQUESTED A UNDERWARRANTY REPLACEMENT PERO PEACKER DAMAGE ON 12/16/2024 BUT NEVER RECEIVED
Root Cause: Warranty policy incorrectly applied due to outdated database entry.
Resolution: Database corrected and replacement order processed.

Short Description: ORDER HAS BEEN CANCELLED BUT THERE STILL OUTSTANDING CLNR RETURNS
Description: ORDER HAS BEEN CANCELLED BUT THERE STILL OUTSTANDING CLNR RETURNS UNABLE TO PROCESS CLNR FOR THE ERROR 'CUSTOMER HAS MET LIMIT OF ALLOWED OPEN CLNR/RENTAL DEVICE REPLACEMENT ORDERS.'
Root Cause: Order cancellation logic did not clear pending returns.
Resolution: Updated process to remove pending returns when order is canceled.

Short Description: DEVICE RETURN FAILED - Customer unable to process return request
Description: Customer attempted to process a device return, but the system displayed an error stating 'Return processing unavailable at this time'.
Root Cause: Backend API outage preventing return processing.
Resolution: API services restored and return requests processed.

Short Description: RETURN LABEL NOT GENERATED - Customer unable to obtain return label
Description: Customer requested a return label for a defective device, but the system failed to generate one.
Root Cause: Label generation service failed due to incorrect request parameters.
Resolution: Fixed parameter validation and label generation resumed.

Short Description: CUSTOMER CHARGED FOR RETURNED DEVICE - Refund not processed
Description: Customer returned a device, but the refund was not issued due to a system error.
Root Cause: Refund processing queue failure.
Resolution: Queue reprocessed and refund issued.

Short Description: EXCHANGE DEVICE NOT SHIPPED - Customer awaiting replacement
Description: Customer was approved for a device exchange, but the new device has not shipped.
Root Cause: Order fulfillment system did not trigger shipment.
Resolution: Re-triggered order fulfillment process.

Short Description: REPLACEMENT DEVICE ACTIVATION FAILED - Unable to activate replacement device
Description: Customer received a replacement device, but activation attempts failed due to a provisioning issue.
Root Cause: Provisioning system did not sync with activation database.
Resolution: Database sync issue resolved, activation completed.

Short Description: When trying to add feature 34646 I get an error FOM Validation Failed 34646 Missing Dacc Required SFO
Description:
Adding Feature Code 34646 private network feature to MTNs on the attached spreadsheet.
        Getting FOM Validation Failed : 34646 - Missing DACC required SFO can't be added.
       
        2700 lines are all on plan code 34646 and worked, but the 166 that failed are on the same plan, same device (Microsoft Surface Pro LTE).
        Attached are screenshots of the error message encountered in Bulk B360 and ACSS.

        Feature trying to add: 34646 Description Private Network to the account, which has plan code 34646 for the 166 affected lines.
        Attached in spreadsheet titled 'feature_add_fom_error'.
Root Cause: Feature validation issue due to missing DACC configuration.
Resolution: Updated validation rules to allow feature addition with correct DACC settings.

Short Description: Failed Upgrade due to an error in B360
Description:
Customer is trying to upgrade the line 8644843018 but encounters an error:
        'FOM Validation Failed : 86226 - Missing parent SFO/feature can't be added.'
       
        New device: iPhone 16 Pro Max White Titanium 256 GB (Model: MYW43LL/A).

        The error appears affiliated with another number (8645084709) that is not being upgraded but has a pending feature change.
Root Cause: System incorrectly associates upgrade request with a different lineâ€™s pending feature change.
Resolution: Adjusted backend processing to separate upgrade requests from unrelated feature changes.

Short Description: Feature addition failing due to missing eligibility check
Description:
Customer is attempting to add feature code 54321 but encounters an error:
        'FOM Validation Failed: 54321 - Eligibility check missing'.

        Issue appears on multiple accounts using device models Samsung Galaxy S22 and iPhone 14.
Root Cause: Eligibility check not being triggered correctly for specific device models.
Resolution: Fixed backend logic to ensure eligibility checks execute before feature addition.

Short Description: Error encountered when attempting bulk feature update
Description:
Attempting to update features in bulk for a corporate account with 5000+ lines fails due to timeout issues.

        Error message: 'Bulk process timeout exceeded'. The issue affects multiple enterprise clients.
Root Cause: Bulk feature update operation exceeding processing time limits.
Resolution: Optimized bulk processing workflow to handle larger transactions efficiently.

Short Description: Activation failure due to incorrect provisioning data
Description:
Customer is unable to activate their new device due to provisioning error:
        'Provisioning data mismatch detected'.

        Device: Google Pixel 8 Pro, Activation System: B360.
Root Cause: Provisioning system incorrectly mapping IMEI to wrong carrier profile.
Resolution: Updated carrier profile mapping logic to prevent mismatches.

Short Description: SIM activation failing due to missing ICCID mapping
Description:
Customer is trying to activate a new SIM card but encounters an error:
        'ICCID not found in database'.

        Device: OnePlus 12, Activation System: ACSS.
Root Cause: ICCID mapping table not updated in real-time, causing activation failures.
Resolution: Implemented real-time updates for ICCID mapping.

Short Description: Customer unable to complete device activation due to pending order
Description: Customer attempted to activate a new device, but the system flagged a pending order from a previous transaction. The old order is stuck in processing since 01/15/2025. Needs to be cleared manually.
Root Cause: System did not properly update the order status due to an API failure.
Resolution: Fixed the API call in order_processing.py to ensure order status updates correctly.

Short Description: Feature addition fails due to missing dependencies
Description: Attempted to add feature code 45678 to customerâ€™s account, but received 'FOM Validation Failed: Missing parent SFO/feature' error.
Root Cause: Feature dependency validation logic was outdated.
Resolution: Updated validation rules in feature_management.py.

Short Description: Customer upgrade blocked due to device mismatch
Description: Customer tried upgrading from iPhone 12 to iPhone 15 but system detected a mismatch with existing device records.
Root Cause: Device database sync failure.
Resolution: Fixed sync issue in device_sync_service.py.

Short Description: Pending deactivation preventing new service activation
Description: Customer cannot activate a new line due to an old pending deactivation request in the system.
Root Cause: Deactivation job failed to complete.
Resolution: Updated cron job handling in account_deactivation.py.

Short Description: Customer order stuck in processing
Description: Customer placed an order for a new device, but it has been stuck in 'processing' status for over a week.
Root Cause: Order processing queue was not consuming messages.
Resolution: Repaired queue processing in order_queue_worker.py.

Short Description: Approval email for order not being sent
Description: Approval email for Order #6789 is not being received by the POC, even though the system logs show it as sent.
Root Cause: Email server configuration issue.
Resolution: Fixed SMTP settings in email_service.py.

Short Description: TYS option missing in service tab
Description: Partner unable to access Transfer Your Service (TYS) option in service tab, limiting their ability to complete transfers.
Root Cause: UI configuration file was missing required permissions.
Resolution: Updated UI permissions in service_tab_config.json.

Short Description: upgrade process fails
Description: Customer upgrade request failed in B360 portal due to validation errors.
Root Cause: Incorrect validation rules in B360.
Resolution: Updated validation logic in b360_upgrade.py.

Short Description: Order cancellation request stuck in processing
Description: Customer requested order cancellation, but the request has been in 'pending' state for more than 48 hours.
Root Cause: Cancellation job queue was not processing requests.
Resolution: Fixed job processing in order_cancellation.py.

Short Description: SIM card activation fails with system error
Description: Customer unable to activate new SIM card. System throws a generic error message during activation.
Root Cause: SIM activation service timeout.
Resolution: Increased timeout settings in sim_activation_service.py.

Short Description: Ordering - Validation Failed
Description: Customer paid off iPhone 13 to upgrade to iPhone 16. Original order 76665(App No. 7658765766) did not process properly. Phone agreement canceled as it would not push through to activation. New application not processing.
Root Cause: Order validation failure due to incorrect provisioning data.
Resolution: Corrected data mismatch in order processing system.

Short Description: Ordering - Serial Number Not Assigned
Description: When selling OneTalk T67LTE phones in the store, system requires a serial number. Attempted to sell both devices, but validation fails stating serial number not assigned to site.
Kibana XML Logs: <log><error>Serial number validation failed for device T67LTE</error></log>
Root Cause: Incorrect device registration in the system.
Resolution: Updated serial number mapping for OneTalk T67LTE models.

Short Description: Account Inquiry - eSIM Activation Issue
Description: Primary device IMEI eSIM not activating on phone. eSIM 2 and IMEI 2 are activated for line ending 9925.
Root Cause: eSIM provisioning failure due to missing activation signal.
Resolution: Manually triggered activation and corrected eSIM profile.

Short Description: Ordering - BTA Required Error
Description: Trying to add BMS, but system indicates no BTA found. BTA is not required for this type of order.
Root Cause: Incorrect validation logic for BTA requirement.
Resolution: Updated validation rule to exclude BTA check for specific orders.

Short Description: ACSS Payment Processing Error
Description: Customer attempted to make payment, but transaction failed due to invalid token response from payment gateway.
Root Cause: Expired payment token caused rejection.
Resolution: Refreshed token mechanism and retried transaction.

Short Description: Billing Cycle Mismatch
Description: Customer's billing cycle incorrectly reset to day 1 after plan change, causing double charge alerts.
Root Cause: Incorrect billing cycle reassignment after plan migration.
Resolution: Corrected cycle assignment and refunded duplicate charge.

Short Description: Customer Login Failure
Description: Customer unable to log in due to invalid session state. Resetting password does not resolve issue.
Root Cause: Session state corruption in authentication module.
Resolution: Cleared session cache and re-authenticated user.

Short Description: IMEI Swap Not Updating
Description: Customer replaced device, but IMEI swap did not reflect in the system, preventing activation.
Root Cause: IMEI mapping not refreshed after swap request.
Resolution: Manually updated IMEI in the database and fixed auto-refresh logic.

Short Description: Error message: 'Sku being searched is a restricted sku.' while trying to search for Accessory
Description: Rep is trying to order the accessory SKU but while searching for it, it is giving the error 'Sku being searched is a restricted sku.' Already checked the Stock and it shows that there are 45 items. Equipment guide also shows the item is in stock.
Symptoms: SKU not found, Restricted SKU error
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: No accessories found / Sku being searched is a restricted sku.
Description: Error: No accessories found / Sku being searched is a restricted sku. Rep is trying to add Apple Care+ to 5 iPads. After Rep tries to add the Apple Care+ SKU she gets the error message. On my mock cart I got the same error. I checked the OST for Apple Care+ and we are using the correct SKU.
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: Accessory SKU validation failing for eligible items
Description: Attempted to add SKU-listed accessories to cart. System blocked the transaction stating 'Restricted SKU' despite verification in the equipment guide.
Symptoms: Accessory purchase blocked, SKU flagged incorrectly
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: System incorrectly restricting accessory purchase
Description: Retail associate unable to complete an accessory order due to 'restricted SKU' prompt despite stock showing available in inventory.
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: Stock available, but SKU marked restricted during checkout
Description: Customer attempted to purchase a certified accessory. Checkout system prevented completion with an incorrect 'SKU restricted' error.
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: Mismatch between stock and SKU validation
Description: Sales system indicates accessory SKU is valid, but order validation fails with a restricted SKU message.
Symptoms: Inconsistent SKU validation across system modules
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: Accessory SKU eligibility not recognized at checkout
Description: Sales rep attempted checkout, but SKU flagged incorrectly. Equipment guide confirms eligibility, issue persists across multiple attempts.
Symptoms: Repeated SKU rejection, eligible product flagged incorrectly
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: Restricted SKU error blocking valid purchases
Description: Retail location experiencing multiple SKU errors for eligible accessories, impacting customer purchases.
Root Cause: SKU validation service misconfiguration in backend logic.
Resolution: Patched SKU validation service logic to correctly identify eligible products.

Short Description: Activation request stuck in provisioning
Description: Customer reported that the activation request for their new device is stuck in provisioning. No updates received.
Root Cause: Backend provisioning system was overloaded, causing timeout.
Resolution: Increased system capacity and optimized processing queue.

Short Description: Switch error preventing activation
Description: User attempted activation, but the request failed due to an EA-SWITCH_ERR message in the system logs.
Root Cause: Configuration mismatch between switch and provisioning system.
Resolution: Updated switch configurations and re-synced with provisioning.

Short Description: Device stuck in pre-activation stage
Description: Customer unable to proceed with activation. System indicates device is in pre-activation but does not complete.
Root Cause: Incorrect validation checks prevented activation from progressing.
Resolution: Fixed validation rules to correctly recognize eligible devices.

Short Description: SIM card provisioning failure
Description: Customer reported that the new SIM card is not being provisioned properly, resulting in an unusable device.
Root Cause: Database synchronization issue between SIM system and provisioning.
Resolution: Implemented real-time sync mechanism for SIM database.

Short Description: Error during IMEI validation
Description: IMEI validation failed during activation process, preventing user from continuing.
Root Cause: IMEI database was not updated with new batch of devices.
Resolution: Updated IMEI records and ensured real-time sync.

Short Description: Network registration failure after activation
Description: User completed activation, but device fails to register on network.
Root Cause: Network registration service did not recognize the device.
Resolution: Patched network registration logic to handle new IMEI formats.

Short Description: Carrier update not applied during activation
Description: Activation completed, but device does not receive carrier settings update.
Root Cause: Carrier update script did not trigger after activation.
Resolution: Fixed script execution order to ensure timely updates.

Short Description: Duplicate activation requests causing failure
Description: Multiple activation requests were triggered for the same device, leading to conflicts.
Root Cause: System did not prevent duplicate activation attempts.
Resolution: Implemented deduplication logic for activation requests.

Short Description: Print pick list shows an error: System Error. Please try again later
Description: Device has been moved to OUTBOUND TRANSFER; however, we cannot access the shipping label as it does not appear in our outbound transfers.
Root Cause: Database query timeout preventing label retrieval.
Resolution: Optimized database queries and added retry mechanism.

Short Description: Trade-In
Description: The device traded under the credit app no. 5658768767 with IMEI 7613587658765757 is stuck in the ship traded screen with a truck icon next to it.
Root Cause: Backend sync issue between shipment tracking and order management system.
Resolution: Implemented real-time sync mechanism to update trade-in status.

Short Description: Shipment tracking information missing
Description: User reports that the shipment tracking details are not visible after initiating a return.
Root Cause: Carrier API integration failure caused missing tracking updates.
Resolution: Reintegrated carrier API and improved tracking updates.

Short Description: Warehouse inventory sync issue
Description: Inventory for SKU 12345 is showing available in system but not in warehouse stock.
Symptoms: Discrepancy between system and warehouse stock
Root Cause: Periodic sync job failed, causing outdated inventory records.
Resolution: Automated inventory sync and added fallback checks.

Short Description: Order status stuck in processing
Description: Order ID 987654321 has been in 'Processing' status for over 48 hours without updates.
Root Cause: Order processing queue congestion due to high load.
Resolution: Implemented load balancing to distribute order processing tasks.

Short Description: Billing statement not generated
Description: Customer's billing statement for January 2025 has not been generated.
Root Cause: Scheduled billing job failed due to system crash.
Resolution: Restarted job scheduler and added failure recovery mechanism.

Short Description: Duplicate order created
Description: Customer reported duplicate orders being created for a single purchase transaction.
Root Cause: Payment gateway retry mechanism caused duplicate order creation.
Resolution: Updated order creation logic to prevent duplicate entries.

Short Description: C2B TYS reaching an issue with the new business account sub account: incompatible plans so needed to be put on different sub
Description: From personal account to business account 034545479-00002, plans are meant to be on Business Unlimited 5G Pro and Numbershare for the watch. After initiating transfer and authentication in the business account, the subaccount selection has defaulted to subaccount -00001. This sub is unable to accept new lines due to incompatible plans between the cameras already on the business account and the lines being transferred. Cleared cache and cookies and system has gone through an ER and mid-month system fix since the issue began. Tried to submit through Salesforce but customer and reps experienced issues with Terms and Condition acceptance.
Symptoms: Transfer fails due to incompatible plans
Root Cause: Default sub-account selection logic overriding manual selection.
Resolution: Updated sub-account selection mechanism to allow manual override.

Short Description: TYS is attempting to transfer lines TYS BE to BE, oc approved transfer to new sub on assuming acct but the transfer is defaulting to sub account 9
Description: Attempting to transfer lines from business account 23453254233 to another business account 34646543562. Assuming POC approved transfer to new sub on assuming account, but the transfer is defaulting to sub account 9. Please resolve error so we can move lines to new sub on relinquishing account. Tried to complete QT in OMNI but the QT would not submit. The request just grayed out.
Kibana XML Logs: TRANSFER_ERRTransfer request stuck due to sub-account mismatch
Symptoms: Transfer request defaulting to incorrect sub-account
Root Cause: Incorrect account hierarchy mapping during transfer.
Resolution: Fixed hierarchy mapping logic to ensure correct sub-account selection.

Short Description: Error in sub-account mapping causing transfer failures
Description: Multiple customers report that line transfers between business sub-accounts fail due to the system automatically selecting an incorrect sub-account.
Root Cause: Legacy mapping system overriding new transfer requests.
Resolution: Updated sub-account validation logic to prevent mismatches.

Short Description: Account merge failure due to sub-account mismatch
Description: Attempting to merge two business accounts results in an error where the system cannot determine the correct sub-account hierarchy.
Root Cause: Conflicting sub-account policies preventing merge.
Resolution: Implemented policy override option for account merges.

Short Description: Billing discrepancy after sub-account migration
Description: Customers report billing inconsistencies after migrating their lines between sub-accounts. Charges do not reflect the expected plan rates.
Symptoms: Unexpected charges appearing on migrated accounts
Root Cause: Incorrect tariff mapping post-migration.
Resolution: Adjusted tariff mapping logic and issued refunds where necessary.

Short Description: System timeout during sub-account creation
Description: Users are unable to create new sub-accounts due to frequent system timeouts, preventing completion of the setup process.
Symptoms: Sub-account creation fails due to system lag
Root Cause: High database latency causing request timeouts.
Resolution: Optimized database queries and increased timeout threshold.

Short Description: Device is on IMEI2 not IMEI1 which the DPA is attached to and needs to be corrected
Description: GCO disconnected wrong line and put DP info forced buyout. PACT BTA override/BGCO could not reinstate due to error. Advised to submit quick ticket.
Root Cause: IMEI mismatch between order system and activation system.
Resolution: Updated activation logic to ensure correct IMEI is used.

Short Description: Upgrade device was activated on IMEI2 not IMEI that was on the order and the DPA did not attach
Description: Customer upgraded their device, but activation system linked it to IMEI2 instead of the ordered IMEI1, preventing the DPA from attaching.
Root Cause: Activation system defaulted to secondary IMEI.
Resolution: Fixed IMEI selection logic to match ordered IMEI.

Short Description: Activation request failed due to IMEI validation error
Description: Customer attempted to activate their device, but the request failed due to an IMEI validation issue, preventing service activation.
Root Cause: Incorrect device mapping in backend validation system.
Resolution: Corrected device database mappings to align with order records.

Short Description: Device activation stuck due to duplicate IMEI
Description: Customer is unable to activate their device as the system detects the IMEI as already in use, preventing completion of the process.
Root Cause: Duplicate IMEI entry in activation database.
Resolution: Implemented duplicate IMEI check and manual resolution process.

Short Description: DPA installment agreement missing after device activation
Description: Customer activated their new device, but the installment agreement was not attached, preventing them from making payments.
Root Cause: Activation process did not link DPA properly.
Resolution: Updated activation workflow to ensure DPA attachment.

Short Description: Device order stuck in processing status
Description: Customer placed an order for a new device, but the order remains stuck in processing, preventing activation and shipment.
Root Cause: Backend order processing service failure.
Resolution: Restarted order service and implemented auto-retry mechanism.

Short Description: Line discounts not applying correctly on renewals
Description: When customers renew their plans, the multi-line discount is not reflecting properly, showing full price instead of the discounted rate.
Root Cause: Pricing API failed to apply discount due to outdated cache.
Resolution: Updated caching logic and refreshed the discount application process.

Short Description: B360 Upgrade Pricing Issue
Description: While upgrading through B360, plan code 3767 is not reflecting the correct pricing, causing customer confusion.
Symptoms: Incorrect plan pricing shown during upgrade
Root Cause: Mismatch in pricing database records due to recent plan modifications.
Resolution: Re-synced pricing database and ensured consistency across systems.

Short Description: Plan ID 4645 shows incorrect price
Description: Rep attempts to upgrade device on an account, but plan price for ID 4645 increases to $113 instead of expected $68 or $73.
Root Cause: Incorrect mapping in pricing tier configurations.
Resolution: Updated pricing tier mappings and tested with multiple scenarios.

Short Description: Unexpected price increase after plan change
Description: Customer switched from Unlimited Basic to Unlimited Plus, but the price increased unexpectedly beyond the advertised rate.
Self Service Variables: Old Plan: Unlimited Basic, New Plan: Unlimited Plus
Root Cause: Old discount codes were not properly deactivated.
Resolution: Revised discount deactivation process to ensure proper application of new plan pricing.

Short Description: Device upgrade causing plan price jump
Description: After upgrading to a new device, the monthly plan cost doubled without any additional features added.
Symptoms: Plan cost increase post device upgrade
Self Service Variables: Upgrade SKU: X123, Previous Plan: $50, New Plan: $100
Root Cause: Plan tier misclassification post-upgrade.
Resolution: Corrected tiering logic and applied fix across similar scenarios.

Short Description: Autopay discount missing after plan change
Description: Customer changed plans and lost the autopay discount, though they remained enrolled in autopay.
Symptoms: Autopay discount missing post plan change
Root Cause: Billing system failed to recognize autopay continuation.
Resolution: Patched system to correctly retain discounts post plan modification.

Short Description: Group discount removed unexpectedly
Description: A customer with multiple lines lost their group discount after adding a new line to the account.
Symptoms: Multi-line discount disappeared after adding new line
Self Service Variables: Account Type: Family Plan, New Line Added: Yes
Root Cause: System misinterpreted account structure, causing discount removal.
Resolution: Corrected account hierarchy recognition to prevent discount loss.

Short Description: Applying accessory discount but not reflecting at checkout
Description: Rep is trying to add 3 accessories using line 7658765765 with a manager discretion discount of $135.00. The total price for the 3 accessories plus tax is $414.00, without the discount. With the manager discretion discount of $135.00, the total price should be $252 plus tax. But after cart validation, the discount didn't apply, and the total price is $404.64.
Symptoms: Discount visible but not applied to total amount
Self Service Variables: Accessory SKU: 12345, Discount Type: Manager Discretion
Root Cause: Cart validation module failed to apply accessory discount due to incorrect tax calculation logic.
Resolution: Updated tax calculation logic to correctly apply discounts before tax computation.

Short Description: Accessory discount not applying to order total
Description: The customer is trying to purchase an accessory but the manual discount is not being applied at checkout. The discount is approved and should be applied.
Kibana XML Logs: <error>DiscountProcessingError: Discount shown but not deducted in final total</error>
Symptoms: Discount appears in cart but final price remains unchanged
Self Service Variables: Accessory SKU: 67890, Discount Type: Manual Override
Root Cause: UI logic displayed discount but failed to sync with backend calculations.
Resolution: Fixed UI-backend synchronization issue for discount reflection.

Short Description: Accessory discount not applying to bulk orders
Description: We're trying to order 13 Cases and I've zeroed them out, but the system still wants to charge them.
Kibana XML Logs: <error>BulkDiscountError: System override failed for bulk discounts</error>
Symptoms: Bulk discount not applied despite override
Self Service Variables: Accessory SKU: 13579, Bulk Discount Applied: Yes
Root Cause: Bulk discount logic failed to process when zero-out override was applied.
Resolution: Updated override logic to ensure zeroed-out bulk discounts apply correctly.

Short Description: Promo discount on accessories not applying at checkout
Description: Promo code entered for accessory purchase shows applied but does not reduce the total amount at checkout.
Symptoms: Promo code applied but no price reduction
Root Cause: Promo code logic processed incorrectly due to priority conflict with other discounts.
Resolution: Resolved priority conflict so promo codes apply before final checkout calculation.

Short Description: Manager approval discount missing on accessories
Description: Manager-approved discount is visible in the summary but disappears at the final payment screen.
Symptoms: Discount shows on review page but disappears at payment
Self Service Variables: Discount Type: Manager Approval, Accessory SKU: 11122
Root Cause: Payment processing step failed to fetch approved discounts.
Resolution: Revised payment gateway logic to correctly pull discounts from approval queue.

Short Description: Accessory discount stacking incorrectly
Description: Customer applied multiple discounts on accessories, but instead of stacking, only the highest discount is applied.
Kibana XML Logs: <error>StackingDiscountError: System only applying one discount instead of multiple</error>
Symptoms: Multiple discounts applied but only one is recognized
Root Cause: Stacking logic incorrectly prioritized only one discount instead of applying all eligible discounts.
Resolution: Fixed discount prioritization algorithm to allow stacking where applicable.

Short Description: Accessory discount visible but price does not change
Description: System shows discount applied in the breakdown, but total due remains unchanged.
Kibana XML Logs: <error>PriceCalculationError: Discount listed but total price unaffected</error>
Symptoms: Discount shows in UI but does not reduce final amount
Root Cause: Final price calculation step failed to consider accessory discounts.
Resolution: Updated final calculation logic to correctly incorporate accessory discounts.

Short Description: Loyalty discount on accessories not applying
Description: Long-time customer eligible for a loyalty discount on accessories, but it is not being applied automatically.
Kibana XML Logs: <error>LoyaltyDiscountError: Customer recognized but discount not granted</error>
Symptoms: Loyalty discount eligibility detected but not applied
Root Cause: Eligibility check completed but discount application logic was bypassed.
Resolution: Fixed logic flow to ensure discounts apply after eligibility confirmation.

Short Description: Trade-In
Description: Could not find maximum trade value of device.
Kibana XML Logs: <error>TradeInValueError: System unable to retrieve maximum trade value</error>
Symptoms: Trade-in value not found for eligible device
Root Cause: Database query timeout while fetching trade-in values.
Resolution: Optimized database query to ensure trade-in values are fetched correctly.

Short Description: AUTO - Trade in amount not populating
Description: Rep and BGCO can't process trade-in because no value is showing up through the system, requesting assistance for this IMEI: 67547654654564365. We are receiving the error message 'Could not find Maximum Trade Value of device.'
Symptoms: Trade-in amount not displaying in system
Root Cause: API miscommunication between trade-in evaluation and pricing services.
Resolution: Implemented retry logic for API calls and improved error handling.

Short Description: AUTO - Trade-in standalone
Description: Validation Failed: Invalid Device ID. Could not find maximum trade value of device.
Symptoms: Trade-in request failing due to invalid device ID
Root Cause: Device IMEI validation incorrectly rejecting valid trade-in requests.
Resolution: Fixed validation logic to properly recognize eligible trade-in devices.

Short Description: Trade-in request fails at checkout
Description: Trade-in discount is not being deducted from the final total. System shows the device is eligible but fails to apply the credit.
Kibana XML Logs: <error>TradeInCreditError: Trade-in value not deducted at checkout</error>
Symptoms: Trade-in value displayed but not applied at checkout
Root Cause: Checkout process failed to fetch trade-in credits from the pricing service.
Resolution: Updated pricing API integration to ensure trade-in credits apply at checkout.

Short Description: Trade-in eligibility check failing
Description: System is incorrectly flagging trade-in eligible devices as ineligible, preventing submission.
Symptoms: Valid trade-in devices being marked as ineligible
Root Cause: Eligibility criteria misalignment in validation logic.
Resolution: Updated eligibility rules to correctly validate trade-in devices.

Short Description: Trade-in promo code not applying
Description: Customer has a valid trade-in promo code, but the system does not recognize it at checkout.
Symptoms: Promo code entered but no discount applied
Root Cause: Promo code validation service not linked to trade-in discounts.
Resolution: Enabled promo code validation within trade-in processing.

Short Description: Trade-in amount displays incorrectly
Description: Trade-in value for eligible devices fluctuates incorrectly between screens, causing confusion.
Symptoms: Trade-in value changes unexpectedly between screens
Root Cause: UI caching issue causing inconsistent trade-in values.
Resolution: Implemented real-time value refresh to display consistent amounts.

Short Description: Trade-in device verification delay
Description: Trade-in verification process taking significantly longer than usual, delaying checkout.
Symptoms: Trade-in verification process slow, impacting order processing
Self Service Variables: Device IMEI: 887766554433221, Trade-In Verification Status: Pending
Root Cause: Backend service experiencing high latency during peak hours.
Resolution: Optimized service response time to handle high traffic efficiently.

Short Description: AUTO - MCS:checkoutCart:MULTIPLE ADDRESS MATCHES WERE FOUND, REFINE ADDRESS AND RESUBMIT
Description: Attempted to complete an order, but received an error: MULTIPLE ADDRESS MATCHES WERE FOUND. Rep attempted different variations of the address, but the issue persists.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
    <timestamp>2025-01-21T10:15:30Z</timestamp>
    <error_code>MCS_CHECKOUT_ERROR</error_code>
    <message>AUTO - MCS:checkoutCart:MULTIPLE ADDRESS MATCHES WERE FOUND, REFINE ADDRESS AND RESUBMIT</message>
    <details>Transaction ID: TXN-5000, User ID: USER-2000</details>
</log>
Symptoms: Unable to proceed with checkout due to system validation errors.
Root Cause: Incorrect data mapping in the order validation service caused mandatory field validation failures.
Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Short Description: ERROR MESSAGE MCS: CHECKOUTCART:INVALID/MISSING MANDATORY FIELDS
Description: WE ARE ATTEMPTING TO ORDER SKU: WINETPERF WNP 60 DAY TRIAL - ENTERPRISE. WHEN WE GET TO THE END OF THE ORDER IT WILL NOT ALLOW US TO VALIDATE THE CART IT GIVES US THE ERROR ABOVE.

    <error_code>MCS_CHECKOUT_ERROR</error_code>

</log>
Symptoms: Unable to proceed with checkout due to system validation errors.
Root Cause: Incorrect data mapping in the order validation service caused mandatory field validation failures.
Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Description: Trying to process an order with the WNP Premium business license, but the error message appears. There is nothing missing in the order or profile.

Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Description: MCS checkout failed when processing enterprise transactions due to incorrect mandatory field validation.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
    <timestamp>2025-01-26T10:15:30Z</timestamp>

Symptoms: Unable to proceed with checkout due to system validation errors.
Root Cause: Incorrect data mapping in the order validation service caused mandatory field validation failures.
Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Description: System flagged an error during order finalization, indicating invalid/missing mandatory fields despite complete form submission.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
    <timestamp>2025-01-27T10:15:30Z</timestamp>
    <error_code>MCS_CHECKOUT_ERROR</error_code>
    <message>System unable to complete checkout due to invalid field mapping.</message>

Symptoms: Unable to proceed with checkout due to system validation errors.
Root Cause: Incorrect data mapping in the order validation service caused mandatory field validation failures.
Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Short Description: Cart validation failure due to missing required order details.
Description: Enterprise customers facing checkout failures due to missing field validations, preventing cart validation at final step.
Kibana XML Logs:
<log>
    <timestamp>2025-01-28T10:15:30Z</timestamp>
    <error_code>MCS_CHECKOUT_ERROR</error_code>
    <message>Cart validation failure due to missing required order details.</message>
    <details>Transaction ID: TXN-5007, User ID: USER-2007</details>
</log>
Symptoms: Unable to proceed with checkout due to system validation errors.
Root Cause: Incorrect data mapping in the order validation service caused mandatory field validation failures.
Resolution: Updated the order validation logic to correctly map and verify required fields before checkout.

Short Description: Joint Offer not applying to cart
Description: Order is placing another router on 34534. The order seems to qualify for the Joint Offer Fixed Wireless Access (FWA).
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Error: Joint Offer validation failed at checkout.</log>
Symptoms: Joint offer missing from cart despite eligibility.
Self Service Variables: Eligible plan and device present, promo missing.
Root Cause: Eligibility check logic did not properly evaluate device type.
Resolution: Updated eligibility logic in backend service.

Short Description: The order not showing joint offer credit of $30
Description: Rep replicated the issue in a quote and a regular cart with no success. I asked the promo core team related to this and they requested a ticket.
Symptoms: Joint offer credit missing from cart.
Self Service Variables: Plan and device meet conditions, credit absent.
Root Cause: Incorrect data mapping between promo service and cart.
Resolution: Fixed mapping issue in the promotion service API.

Short Description: LTE joint offer not working despite meeting requirements
Description: Customer is trying to apply the TE BI $30 Joint Offer Credit. They have a compatible device and plan, but it is not being applied.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Warning: Joint offer validation returned false unexpectedly.</log>
Symptoms: Promo not applied even when eligibility conditions met.
Root Cause: Eligibility service caching outdated data.
Resolution: Cleared cache and updated refresh intervals.

Short Description: Joint Offer credit appears and disappears during checkout
Description: The $30 joint offer credit appears during cart validation but disappears at final checkout step.
Symptoms: Promo initially visible but removed later.
Self Service Variables: Credit present during validation, absent at checkout.
Root Cause: Timeout issue in the promotion API response.
Resolution: Increased API timeout and added retry logic.

Short Description: Joint offer eligibility failing for prepaid customers
Description: Prepaid customers meeting all criteria for the promo are not getting the $30 credit.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Error: Prepaid account incorrectly excluded from promo.</log>
Self Service Variables: Prepaid plan should be eligible, but credit missing.
Root Cause: Prepaid accounts were not included in eligibility rules.
Resolution: Updated business rules to include prepaid accounts.

Short Description: Joint offer only applying to one line on multi-line account
Description: A customer with a multi-line account is only receiving the $30 promo on one line instead of all eligible lines.
Symptoms: Discount applied inconsistently across multiple lines.
Self Service Variables: Multi-line plan detected, discount missing on some lines.
Root Cause: Promo engine incorrectly limited credit to one line per account.
Resolution: Updated promo logic to apply per line instead of per account.

Short Description: Joint offer removed after adding additional items
Description: The promo discount disappears when adding another product to the cart, even if it doesn't affect eligibility.
Symptoms: Discount removed when cart items changed.
Self Service Variables: Additional items should not impact promo.
Root Cause: Cart recalculation erroneously invalidated promo.
Resolution: Adjusted cart recalculation rules.

Short Description: Joint offer credit applies but does not reflect in total price
Description: Promo appears correctly in the breakdown but is not deducted from the final total.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Error: Discount reflected in UI but not in total calculation.</log>
Symptoms: Promo visually present but not applied in total.
Self Service Variables: Displayed discount does not impact final price.
Root Cause: Incorrect calculation of final price due to promo misclassification.
Resolution: Fixed pricing calculation logic in checkout service.

Short Description: Error: DEVICE AND SIM ARE NOT COMPATIBLE FOR MTN 7657656753
Description: The error message is related to MTN 325325352123 but the order is for a new line. There is no reason the error should appear as there are no restrictions preventing this device from being used.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Error DEVICE AND SIM ARE NOT COMPATIBLE FOR MTN</log>
Symptoms: Order fails due to incorrect compatibility error.
Root Cause: Incorrect validation rule applied to the MTN range.
Resolution: Updated validation logic to correctly check device compatibility.

Short Description: DEVICE AND SIM ARE NOT COMPATIBLE FOR MTN
Description: Rep is doing a feature change but is receiving the error message for line: 34634634623. Mock cart attempts also failed.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Feature change validation failed due to MTN-SIM mismatch</log>
Symptoms: Feature change fails due to incorrect SIM/device pairing.
Root Cause: System incorrectly flagged the SIM as incompatible.
Resolution: Updated feature validation to allow proper pairing.

Short Description: New line activation blocked due to MTN restriction
Description: Customer is unable to activate a new line as the system incorrectly flags the MTN as already in use.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Activation request failed due to pre-existing MTN record</log>
Root Cause: Duplicate MTN entries in the system.
Resolution: Removed redundant MTN records to prevent false conflicts.

Short Description: SIM swap failing due to device mismatch
Description: Rep attempted a SIM swap but system flagged the new SIM as incompatible with the device despite correct IMEI and MTN.
Symptoms: SIM swap fails even when device and SIM are correct.
Root Cause: Faulty SIM-device compatibility logic.
Resolution: Refactored validation logic to correctly check SIM compatibility.

Short Description: MTN validation error blocking device upgrade
Description: Attempting to upgrade a device results in an MTN validation error, preventing the upgrade.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>Upgrade attempt blocked due to invalid MTN mapping</log>
Symptoms: Device upgrade fails due to MTN validation error.
Root Cause: Legacy MTN format not properly handled.
Resolution: Updated system to recognize legacy MTN formats.

Short Description: New SIM activation fails due to incorrect device mapping
Description: Activating a new SIM for an existing device leads to a mapping error, causing the activation to fail.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>New SIM activation blocked due to incorrect device mapping</log>
Symptoms: New SIM cannot be activated due to mapping issue.
Root Cause: Incorrect mapping between SIM and device in database.
Resolution: Fixed database mappings to correctly associate devices and SIMs.

Short Description: Order validation fails due to incorrect MTN-SIM pairing
Description: When validating an order, the system rejects it due to an invalid MTN-SIM pairing, despite the details being correct.
Symptoms: Order cannot be validated due to pairing issues.
Root Cause: Bug in validation logic misidentifying valid pairs as invalid.
Resolution: Updated validation rules to correctly recognize compatible pairs.

Short Description: SIM transfer fails due to incorrect MTN assignment
Description: Customer requested a SIM transfer, but the system incorrectly associates the new SIM with an invalid MTN.
Kibana XML Logs: <log>SIM transfer request failed due to invalid MTN assignment</log>
Symptoms: SIM transfer fails despite correct details.
Root Cause: MTN assignment logic incorrectly reassigning numbers.
Resolution: Fixed logic to correctly maintain existing MTN assignments.

Short Description: Payment authorization failure for valid card
Description: Rep attempted to process a payment using a valid corporate credit card, but received 'Authorization Failed' despite sufficient funds.
Root Cause: Incorrect API response mapping
Resolution: Updated API response handler to correctly interpret authorization status

Short Description: Order checkout failing due to payment mismatch
Description: Customer attempted to finalize an order but received 'Payment Mismatch' error despite using a single payment method.
Root Cause: Incorrect logic classifying transactions as split payments
Resolution: Fixed classification logic to properly detect single payments

Short Description: Payment error prevents order completion
Description: Rep encountered 'Transaction Cannot be Completed' error at the final step of order processing.
Root Cause: Missing finalization callback in payment API
Resolution: Implemented missing callback to confirm payment completion

Short Description: Discounted order failing at checkout
Description: Rep applied a valid discount, but the system is rejecting the order with 'Invalid Pricing Structure' error.
Root Cause: Incorrect discount validation logic
Resolution: Updated pricing validation to correctly recognize discounts

Short Description: Gift card payment rejection
Description: Customer attempted to pay using a gift card, but system incorrectly flagged it as an unsupported payment method.
Symptoms: Valid gift card being rejected at checkout
Root Cause: Gift card payments not recognized in new payment gateway
Resolution: Updated gateway configuration to include gift card support

Short Description: BTA (Bill To Account) transaction failure
Description: Rep attempted to process a BTA payment, but the system returned 'Account Not Eligible' error despite customer approval.
Symptoms: Approved customers unable to use BTA
Root Cause: Eligibility check not updated for recent account type changes
Resolution: Fixed eligibility logic to properly recognize approved accounts

Short Description: Recurring payment setup failure
Description: Customer tried to enroll in a recurring payment plan but got 'Enrollment Failed' error despite valid bank details.
Root Cause: API missing required fields for recurring payment processing
Resolution: Updated API to include required parameters for recurring setup

Short Description: International transaction failure
Description: Rep attempted an international transaction but system returned 'Unsupported Currency' error despite the currency being supported.
Symptoms: International payments failing for supported currencies
Root Cause: Payment gateway misconfigured for international payments
Resolution: Fixed currency configuration in payment gateway
